definition: Bai Chongxi (1893-1966), a leader of Guangxi warlord faction, top Nationalist general, played important role in Chiang Kaishek's campaigns 1926-1949
surname Bai

white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera
high/sublime/lofty/to esteem/to worship
surname Chong
joy

sentences.english: According to Pai, this system had already been implemented in Chekiang .
sentences.chinese: 根据白崇禧说，这个体系已经在浙江执行。

sentences.english: Pai Ch'ung-hsi then took over as principal of the aviation academy and as commander of the air force.
sentences.chinese: 随后白崇禧作为空军司令员和航空学院校长接管空军。

sentences.english: Pai Chung-hsi and the Hupeh Provincial Council immediately brought the question of peace before the generalissimo.
sentences.chinese: 白崇禧和湖北省参议会立即向蒋提出实现和平的问题。

sentences.english: Pai maneuvered himself into a strategic position in Central China and became commander of the government's defense at Hankow.
sentences.chinese: 白崇禧设法混到汉口担任华中剿匪总司令的要职。

definition: Li Zongren (1891-1969), a leader of Guangxi warlord faction
He Yingqin (1890-1987), senior Guomindang general
Chiang Kai-shek (1887-1975), military leader, head of the Nationalist government in China 1928-1949 and the government in exile on Taiwan 1950-1975
Zhang Zhizhong (1890-1969), National Revolutionary Army general
Guomindang or Kuomintang (KMT)/Nationalist Party
Yan Xishan (1883-1960), warlord in Shanxi
Guangxi warlord faction, from 1911-1930
Fu Zuoyi (1895-1974), Guomindang general, subsequently PRC top general and politician
Lin Biao (1908-1971), Chinese army leader at time of the Cultural Revolution
Su Yu (1907-1984), PLA commander
Chen Jiongming (1878-1933), a leading warlord of Guangdong faction, defeated in 1925 and fled to Hong Kong
nationalist forces
Lu Rongting (1858-1928), provincial governor of Guangxi under the Qing, subsequently leader of old Guangxi warlord faction
Feng Yuxiang (1882-1948), warlord during Republic of China, strongly critical of Chiang Kai-shek
Zhang Xueliang (1901-2001) son of Fengtian clique warlord, then senior general for the Nationalists and subsequently for the People's Liberation Army
Chen Yi (1901-1972), communist general and politician, Marshal of PLA from 1955, Mayor of Shanghai in 1950s, PRC foreign minister 1958-1972
